title: Flight 93 National Memorial: Plan Your Visit
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit           Plan Your Visit       Welcome to Flight 93 National Memorial. Flight 93 National Memorial officially dedicated and opened the first elements of the permanent memorial on Saturday September 10, 2011. The Visitor Center was dedicated and opened on September 10, 2015. Please check our hours of operation and other links under the 'Plan Your Visit' section when preparing a visit to the memorial.  Tickets No Longer Required For Visitor Center Entry During September and October 2015, free tickets were required for entry to the Visitor Center due to high visitation, however currently tickets no longer required.  There is no fee to visit.         Basic Information Need some details on how to plan your visiting including hours of operation, RV parking, and policies concerning pets?  Check out the basic information section.          Group Visit Information Visiting with a bus group, school group, motorcycle ride, or other large group? Thinking about conducting a wreath laying or other ceremony as part of your visit? Find out how to plan your group visit.          Places to Go Find out more about the different places to go within the memorial including the new Visitor Center, the Memorial Plaza at the crash site, and the new walking trails.          Calendar of Events Interpretive programs? Activities for kids? Find out what is going on at the memorial to help you plan your visit.
